title.native: スーパーナチュラル・ザ・アニメーション

description:
The anime re-imagining of the original live-action series follows the Winchester brothers Sam and Dean as they hunt creatures and other supernatural phenomena across the American landscape.

The anime covers the storyline of the live-action version's first two seasons as well as original episodes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Cars
tags.description: Centers around the use of automotive vehicles.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/136171134)

A long-serving anime producer, as well as a founder of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/), [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) and [Studio M2](https://anilist.co/studio/6137/). He currently serves as the Chairman of the Board at [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Maruyama graduated from Hosei University in 1963, and soon after, he found work at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1965. It was here that he met many of Madhouse's future staff members. In October 1972, he left Mushi Production together with [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/) and founded Madhouse. From that time onward, Maruyama focused mainly on producing and planning Madhouse's upcoming projects. He also served as the studio's president through the '80s and '90s.

Thanks in large part to his frequent attendance at anime conventions, he has become well-known in America among Madhouse's fanbase. Not simply wanting to emulate past successes, Maruyama frequently says at these events that his goal as a producer is to seek out new challenges that will allow the production staff to keep experimenting. This attitude in part has been the reason why he has encouraged the studio to take on projects that may not seem like sure-fire commercial hits. In addition, Maruyama has long been a supporter of bringing new talents into the animation business, and continues to encourage young people to work in anime.

In 2011, he left Madhouse and founded Mappa. Later in 2016, he left Mappa and founded Studio M2.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮繁之)

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/therealkripke) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/erickripke1/?hl=en)

Eric Kripke is an American writer and television producer. Kripke came to prominence in the late 2000s for creating The WB/CW fantasy drama series Supernatural. He served as the showrunner during the first five seasons of the series. Since then, he has created and/or produced a number of television series including Revolution, Timeless, and The Boys.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Graduated: Aichi University of the Arts (March, 2007)

Kotono Watanabe is a Japanese director and storyboard artist, who mainly does episode direction. After her graduation from Aichi University she joined studio Madhouse in April of the same year.

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Twitter](https://x.com/sawa_zawazawa)

CNBLUE is a South Korean pop rock band formed in 2009. The band consists of [Yong-Hwa Jeong](https://anilist.co/staff/281641) (leader, main vocals, guitar, keyboard, rap), Min-Hyeok Kang (drums), and Jeong-Sin Lee (bass).

[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tamai_kenji)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tamaken0906)

Kenji Tamai is a Japanese producer, sound producer, vocal contractor, composer, arranger, lyricist and he is also the Representative Director of the sound production team agehasprings.

__[Profile (onetrap)](https://onetrap.ageha.net/archives/onetrap_creator/kanamaru_yoshifumi)__

__Yoshifumi Kanamaru__ is a Japanese lyricist and composer affiliated with onetrap.
